summary: A U.S. Customs and Border Protection TECS Person Encounter List generated on January 23, 2020, detailing Jeffrey Epstein's international travel history from 1992 to 2000. The document records numerous flights, primarily between JFK and London/Paris, and lists the names of CBP officers who processed his entries.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The primary subject of the travel log, showing his frequent international flights, primarily between New York (JFK) and London (LHR) or Paris (CDG).

connections.description: Meder generated the law enforcement travel record documenting Epstein's flight history.
Martinez processed Epstein's customs entries on at least three separate occasions in 1997.

events.title: Epstein Flight Record - JFK to LHR
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein traveled from JFK to London Heathrow (LHR) on British Airways.

events.title: Epstein Flight Record - LAX to SYD
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein traveled from Los Angeles (LAX) to Sydney, Australia (SYD) on Qantas flight QF 107.

events.title: Epstein Flight Record - Private Flight
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein traveled on a private flight (carrier code PV, flight 908JE).

events.title: Epstein Flight Record - Private Flight
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein traveled on a private flight (carrier code PV, flight 505LS).

events.title: Epstein Flight Record - JFK to LHR
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein's last recorded flight in this log, traveling from JFK to London Heathrow (LHR).

locations: JFK (John F Kennedy International Airport, New York)
CDG (Paris Charles de Gaulle Airport, France)
A511 (CBP - Cyril E King International Airport)
keyFacts: The document is a law enforcement travel log (TECS) showing Jeffrey Epstein's extensive international travel from 1992 to 2000, with 40 recorded encounters.
Epstein's travel was heavily concentrated between New York (JFK) and London (LHR), with frequent trips to Paris (CDG) and occasional travel to Sydney, Honolulu, and Tokyo.
The log records several trips on private flights (carrier code 'PV'), including flights 908JE and 505LS.
The document lists the names of numerous U.S. Customs and Border Protection officers who processed Epstein's entries at various airports.
The record was generated on January 23, 2020, by CBP Officer Kimberly Meder, indicating continued law enforcement interest in Epstein's travel history years after his death.
